itemLabel: John Kerr, Baron Kerr of Kinlochard

wikipedia_page.main: John Olav Kerr, Baron Kerr of Kinlochard  (born 22 February 1942), is a Scottish politician and former diplomat, now Deputy Chairman of Scottish Power and a crossbench member of the House of Lords. He was a member of the European Convention that first drafted what became Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty, which came into force in December 2009.
